intro: Triplaris riedeliana, commonly known as the Riedel's triplaris, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rhamnaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by elongated, woody fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in humid, lowland environments and is often found in secondary forests. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
